list_definition.definition: an area in which children can play in a park, outside a school etc

list_ex_of_english: The gates have to be left open because of other users and the playgrounds are said to be dangerous for this reason.
They should clamp down with more vigour on the illicit selling of bootleg cigarettes in the vicinity of school playgrounds.
The legislation would help to prevent needless injury to many children in our playgrounds.
There are no playgrounds, and the only place for them to play is in the streets.
I have also received many complaints from parents and grandparents about syringes and needles being found in school playgrounds.
Perhaps we need to build suitable adult playgrounds.
Does he realise that matters have got so serious that we have miner fighting miner, with problems spilling over into school playgrounds?
Information from the questionnaires revealed that dogs did gain entrance into fenced playgrounds through drainage outlets underneath gate doors, in search of food.
